docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''An Appetite Killer for a Killer Appetite? Not Yet'' (April 19): Having spent several years leading the struggle to develop hoodia at Pfizer, I can justly reinforce the cautionary note in the article. An early clinical trial indeed showed that hoodia could be a potent appetite suppressant. But there were indications of unwanted effects on the liver caused by other components, which could not be easily removed from the supplement.

docs.lead_paragraph: Did Pythagoras have epilepsy? How about Leonardo da Vinci? Or James Madison? No, no and no, says a new study. For that matter, neither did Agatha Christie, Niccolo Paganini or William Pitt.
docs.snippet: Did Pythagoras have epilepsy? How about Leonardo da Vinci? Or James Madison? No, no and no, says a new study.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The problem with marital therapy is that it doesn't pay enough attention to the spouses (''Married With Problems?''). Focusing on marital communication and behavior alone does little to address each spouse's underlying problems or issues. Some of those problems need attention in psychotherapy; others might need appropriate medication for an anxiety or depressive disorder.
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    The problem with marital therapy is that it doesn't pay enough attention to the spouses (''Married With Problems?'').     Focusing on marital communication and behavior alone does little to address each spouse's underlying problems...

docs.lead_paragraph: The thing about surgery -- as in the verb form, doing surgery -- is that it is so serious. But after surgeons retire, it becomes a noun, a memory, selective. And what surgeons like to remember about their surgical adventures is how funny they could be.

headline.main: Far From the Medical Trenches, It's O.K. to Laugh

docs.snippet: What surgeons like to remember about their surgical adventures is how funny they could be.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Married With Problems?'': Why should marital counseling that helps couples understand that they are incompatible and eases their acceptance of separation be condemned as failure? KEN LAWRENCE Bellefonte, Pa.
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''Married With Problems?'': Why should marital counseling that helps couples understand that they are incompatible and eases their acceptance of separation be condemned as failure?    KEN LAWRENCE  Bellefonte, Pa.

docs.lead_paragraph: It often occurs to me, having spent most of the last decade working in shelters for the homeless mentally ill, that I am not where I am supposed to be. I went to all the right schools -- Andover, Harvard, Columbia -- and was on the fast track for a far more bourgeois and lucrative career, like being a doctor or lawyer.

headline.main: A Healing Journey, From Harvard to the Homeless Shelters

docs.snippet: For the author, counseling the mentally ill turned into a form of self-therapy.

docs.lead_paragraph: University of California researchers calculate that in large urban areas, children riding in school buses with diesel engines collectively inhale more school bus exhaust than everyone else in the city combined. Exposure to the ultrafine diesel particulate matter, or D.P.M., is known to raise the risk for cancer.

headline.main: Pollution Risk Is Found On Diesel School Buses

docs.snippet: University of California researchers calculate that in large urban areas, children riding in school buses with diesel engines collectively inhale more school bus exhaust than everyone else in the city combined.

docs.lead_paragraph: ''During the past month, how many times have you driven when you've had perhaps too much to drink?'' This question has been part of a survey conducted periodically of about 100,000 Americans over the past decade. And over the years, people reported fewer and fewer occasions.
docs.snippet: A new study by researchers from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that in recent years, the number of times people reported driving after drinking too much increased by 37 percent.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Married With Problems?'' : The writer points out that many people who practice marriage and family therapy have no special training in it. It is likely that many of the unhappy outcomes reported in the article are related to this problem.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many animals hibernate, although mice have never been among them. But big changes may be ahead in the mouse world. Researchers have succeeded in putting mice, without harming them, into a state of suspended animation that looks suspiciously like that of a hibernating bear.

headline.main: Hibernating Mice May Someday Save Humans

docs.snippet: Researchers have succeeded in putting mice, without harming them, into a state of suspended animation that looks suspiciously like that of a hibernating bear.
